info.title: Enterobase-API
info.description:
API for EnteroBase (http://enterobase.warwick.ac.uk) 

EnteroBase is a user-friendly online resource, where users can upload their 
own sequencing data for de novo assembly by a stream-lined pipeline. The assemblies 
are used for calling MLST and wgMLST patterns, allowing users to compare their strains 
to publically available genotyping data from other EnteroBase users, GenBank and classical MLST databases.

Click here to find how to get and use an API token: http://bit.ly/1TKlaOU

get.description: Top level information about EnteroBase databases

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Database prefix, e.g. SAL for Salmonella

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Species database name (senterica, ecoli, yersinia, mcatarrhalis) for Salmonella, Escherichia, Yersinia, Moraxella respectively

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Database description

403.description: Unauthorised access for this specific resource or data

get.description: Login endpoint, refresh your API token

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: EnteroBase username

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: EnteroBase Password

403.description: Unauthorised access for this specific resource or data

get.description: Generic endpoint for lookup list of barcodes

parameters.name: barcode
parameters.description: Unique barcode for Traces records, <database prefix>_<ID code>_<Table code> e.g. SAL_AA0001AA_ST

403.description: Unauthorised access for this specific resource or data

408.description: Connection timeout, please try again later.
